newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Golden Vale restructures divisions.
newsitem.headline: Golden Vale restructures divisions.

text.p: Irish food company Golden Vale Plc on Tuesday said it was restructuring its divisions designed to increase focus on the Group's core business areas.

"We are firmly focused on achieving our financial and other objectives for 1997," Group Managing Director, Jim Murphy, said in a statement. "This new structure will enable each division to concentrate all its efforts on its own products, geographical markets and business development."
Golden Vale announced a number of personnel changes.
It said Paul Marron, currently General Manager, Food Service will be leaving Golden Vale by mutual agreement to pursue a number of options in the development of his career outside the Group.
Liam Woulfe has been appointed executive director for the butter and milk powders division and Liam Mackessy has been appointed executive director of fluid milk and specialist businesses division.
It said John Gleeson is appointed Commercial Director with additional responsibility for the group's Agri business, milk assembly activities and group technical Services.
An Executive Director for the Cheese and Spreads Division will be appointed in due course, it said.
